results.definition: a depression forming the ground under a body of water
examples: he searched for treasure on the ocean bed

results.definition: single thickness of usually some homogeneous substance
examples: slices of hard-boiled egg on a bed of spinach
He goes to bed at the crack of dawn

results.definition: a stratum of ore or coal thick enough to be mined with profit
examples: he worked in the coal beds

results.definition: a foundation of earth or rock supporting a road or railroad track
examples: the track bed had washed away

results.definition: a piece of furniture that provides a place to sleep
examples: he sat on the edge of the bed
the room had only a bed and chair

results.definition: a plot of ground in which plants are growing
examples: the gardener planted a bed of roses
The inn keeper could bed all the new arrivals

results.definition: (geology) a stratum of rock (especially sedimentary rock)
examples: they found a bed of sandstone

results.definition: place (plants) in a prepared bed of soil

examples: The children were bedded at ten o'clock

results.definition: the flat surface of a printing press on which the type form is laid in the last stage of producing a newspaper or magazine or book etc.
